WorkItem.Description:
Hello fellow comunity members,
 
I'm using VB.NET as well as the "R" language for academic reasons.
R has every mathematical function known to man available with just one command, but lacks a user interface.
VB.NET is a powerful language, has astonishing user interface but lacks nearly all mathematical functions.
 
I want to use "R" from VB.NET, so as to create freeware programs for my university with a user interface.
StatconnDCOM is a program doing this very thing, enabling users to use R from any programing language, but its license has too many limitations, and the creator of it told me that it might not always be free.
I cant create a freeware program, and later on tell the university that, hey, you know.. i never said it's gonna be free for ever.
 
Is there any other way to connect R with VB.NET ??
